results.title: Flipper the seal
results.brief_description: One of a series of films produced as a background for reading and expression. Following a visit to a zoo, one of the young visitors decides to learn more about seals. While he reads such words as “waves”, “swimming”, “dive” and “fur”, seals are shown in their natural surroundings swimming, playing and caring for their young. Other activities, such as clay modelling and writing a story about seals, are suggested as a class project.

results.title: Flight
results.creator_credit: Josef Reeve, Guy Glover and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film about the sport of gliding, which creates the feeling of what it is like to soar as silently and effortlessly as a gull. This is a captivating journey into nearer space, where all the beauty of earth and heaven seems to meet at the wide-winged engineless craft poised between them. It will appeal to the adventuresome, but every audience will enjoy these unusual views of Canada’s Laurentians and Rockies.

results.title: Fixed for death
results.creator_credit: Pauline Shaw and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Facts Are These”.
Investigates drug addiction among the under twenties. Includes group discussion with registered addicts at a hospital in Birmingham, showing their apathy and disgust. Considers the effects on the families of addicts. Points out the dangers of becoming hooked by experimentation.

results.title: Five, four, three, two, one birds away
results.brief_description: In a simulated attack by a Jindivik unmanned target aircraft, the destroyer H.M.A.S. Hobart demonstrates its new electronic detection and defence systems, firing a Tarter guided missile. Part of the Navy in Focus series.

results.title: The Five
results.creator_credit: Joy Batchelor and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: An animated health education film for school children designed to create a positive attitude in the minds of young girls aged 8-12 years. it seeks to encourage them to look after their feet, and emphasises the importance of wearing correctly fitted shoes. Animated by Harold Whitaker.

results.title: Fishing on the coast of Japan
results.creator_credit: Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: Depicts the rigorous existence of Japanese fisherman. This film is non-narrated with Japanese music serving as the background. Shows the preparation of the nets, men and women pulling the boats into the sea, look outs for fish, the final catch, return home and the unloading. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Fish that nearly drowned
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Moscow Educational Films
results.brief_description: A voice-over of aquarium scenes describing an Asian fish that can breathe air. Tells the story of various incidents that take place in the aquarium including the life habits of the fish showing how it builds its nest, and how an accident nearly causes its death.

results.title: First principles and reflection
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Light”.
Demonstrates how light is invisible and how light travels in straight lines. Beams of light are used to show the formation of shadows, both umbra and penumbra. Solar and lunar eclipses are illustrated by diagrams and actual photographs. Explains the laws of reflection at a plan surface, the equality of angles of incidence and reflection being compared with the movement of a billiard ball. Practical examples are used to illustrate the formation of images in plane mirrors and the lateral inversion of these.

results.title: The First pollution
results.brief_description: Reports on current efforts to clean up soources of water supply in America and potential solutions to the problem of water pollution. Comparative footage of two major rivers shows the results of an expanding program of waste treatment. Illustrates industry’s role in controlling and reducing pollution hazards. Visits the waste treatment plant at Lake Tahoe.
